@Schmand You probably aren't going to read this because it has been several months but, read wikipedia by googling this: Dōjinshi. Also, doujinshis are sold in stores in Japan and they aren't that cheap. You can tell the difference between a doujin and a manga before clicking any of the thumbnails by seeing that the mangas don't have covers on them - that's because it's serialized for one compiled manga book. What I didn't know is that some people on the internet care (very much) about distinguishing between doujins and mangas - to me they are both just categorized as hentai mangas.

@metroid "OVA is not some kind of different medium or genre, it's simply a name to specify the way an anime is published" Exactly, that's why you call an OVA an Anime, because you can't tell by watching an OVA how it was published. Same as with this. If you just read new released works, you can't tell what it is until you look into the categories. What if it didn't say which category it belongs to? What i'm saying is, how do you tell from just reading a work here? What i see is, mangas do not have copyrighted work in them and have the standard volume size of about 200 pages, whilst doujinshi CAN have copyrighted work and can have as many pages as they want, because they do not have volumes and aren't sold in stores. Now, i still don't get what the deal with "doujin" is. Why exactly is there a term for the work of a person or group of people? So it's like animator? Artist? Indie-artist? So why would that be relevant with any of this?

@
Schmand To answer your stupid question "If you read a a work here, how you do you tell if it is manga/doujinshi/doujin? I have zero clue, please tell me. " Just look at the categories section of the hentai and you would know .  Easy huh?

@Schmand All OVAs are anime you cocksucker retard  OVA is not some kind of different medium or genre, it's simply a name to specify the  way an anime is published . And it's such bullshit to claim that "If you watch a Cartoon, you know it is a cartoon and not anime" most people don't know the difference between two  and call every animated thing cartoon even though it's anime, and no they are not the same thing. Doujin is not the name of product you moron , it's the name referring to the work of a person or group of people who create the products like doujinshi  games or  doujinshi  manga etc.  And the biggest difference, other than one of them is a  self published work, between a regular manga and  a doujinshi manga is that the doujinshi manga is technically illegal to produce most of the time since it's based on a copyrighted  work . That's why you dont see doujinshi manga imported to the west and sold on stores like normal manga.

If you watch an OVA, you don't know if it is an OVA or an Anime. If you watch a Cartoon, you know it is a cartoon and not anime. Same as this here. If you read a a work here, how you do you tell if it is manga/doujinshi/doujin? I have zero clue, please tell me. And why is it so important to you to know that? And even if you can tell, it's still just better to call it all manga. How about we give every single bit of change in a media a different name. *unnecessary sentences of insults*
